sentences.en: ...the factors that incline us toward particular beliefs.
sentences.cn: …使我们倾向于特定信念的种种因素。

sentences.en: Galileo rolled small metal balls down the incline.
sentences.cn: 伽利略让小金属球从斜面滚下.

sentences.en: He had to incline forward to hear her clearly.
sentences.cn: 为听清她的话,他不得不向前探身.

sentences.en: Her words did not incline me to help her.
I incline to ( take ) the opposite point of view.
I incline to [ towards ] tiredness in winter.
I incline to his opinion on this matter.
sentences.cn: 对这件事我倾向于他的观点.

sentences.en: I incline to the view that he is right.
sentences.cn: 我倾向于认为他是正确的。

sentences.en: I incline to the view that we should take no action at this stage.
sentences.cn: 我倾向于认为我们在这个阶段不应采取行动。

sentences.en: I incline to tiredness in winter.
Incline your body from the waist you bow.
sentences.cn: 当你鞠躬时,请从腰部弯身.

sentences.en: Option for feeding cup, either incline type or vertical type.
sentences.cn: 皮带斜坡进杯和立式进杯, 可先配.

sentences.en: The car inclines to incline and to slide to roll and collides to the abutment.
sentences.cn: 汽车侧倾、滑滚并撞到了桥台上.

sentences.en: The men had to slog up a steep muddy incline.
sentences.cn: 人们只得在陡峭而泥泞的斜坡上艰难地行进。

sentences.en: The road has a steep incline.
sentences.cn: 这条路有个很陡的斜坡.

sentences.en: The telescope is inclined at an angle of 43 degrees.
sentences.cn: 这架望远镜以43度角倾斜。

words.tran_cn: 倾角罗盘；倾斜计；倾角计
倾斜；倾向（incline的ing形式）；点头弯腰

trans.tran_en: if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

trans.tran_cn: （使）倾斜，弄斜，（使）偏向，倾向于，（使）认为，点（头）（以示同意、打招呼等）
